p: The existence of integrated genes of filoviruses in some genomes of small rodents, insectivorous bats, shrews, tenrecs (insectivora from Madagascar), and marsupials indicates a history of infection with filoviruses in these groups as well. However, it has to be stressed that infectious Ebola virus have not yet been isolated from any nonhuman animal (Taylor etÂ al. 2010).
